intro: Bosqueia boiviniana, commonly known as the Boivin's bosquea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its small, evergreen leaves and clusters of yellowish-green flowers. The plant typically grows in shrubland and forest understory environments, preferring well-drained soils. It is known for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated for its compact growth habit and seasonal blooms. Due to habitat loss, it is considered threatened in some regions.
